# Captain Void-Illusion

Captain Void-Illusion is one of four "Captains" that you can encounter in Chapter 3 of Black Myth Wukong. Unlike the other Captains, Void-Illusion isn't actually a boss fight, but still has an important item to loot.

* **Rewards:** Spirit of Captain Void-Illusion

## Where to Find Captain Void-Illusion

You can find Captain Void-Illusion along the Road of Longevity in the Valley of Ecstasy. From the Shrine, head directly right and up the small hill past a large inacessible tower. You'll find a large corpse of some kind at the base of a statue built into the cliffs ahead.
img_below_text: This is actually one of the four Captains that the Pagoda Realm Prisoner spoke of, but it looks like someone beat you to putting this captain out of their misery. You can still interact with the body to claim the Spirit of Captain Void-Illusion. And hey, since they still count as a Yaoguai Chief in the journal, that's one less boss to worry about!

Captain Void-Illusion is one of four captains encountered in Chapter 3 of *Black Myth: Wukong*. Unlike other captains, Void-Illusion is not a boss fight but offers an important reward: the Spirit of Captain Void-Illusion. The captain is located along the Road of Longevity in the Valley of Ecstasy, near a statue built into the cliffs.

Image Summary:  
The image depicts a snowy landscape with a character approaching a large corpse lying at the base of a cliffside statue. The corpse appears to be the remains of Captain Void-Illusion, situated in the described location. The scene visually aligns with the narrative context of finding and interacting with the captain's body.

Following Text Summary:  
Captain Void-Illusion is already deceased when encountered, as someone else has defeated them. However, players can still interact with the body to claim the Spirit of Captain Void-Illusion. The captain is considered a Yaoguai Chief in the journal, reducing the number of bosses to face.
